lines: Laughter is the shortest distance between two people.
author: Victor Borge

lines: A laugh is a smile that bursts.
author: Mary H. Waldrip

lines: I have seen what a laugh can do. It can transform almost unbearable tears into something bearable, even hopeful.
author: Bob Hope

lines: Laughter is the fireworks of the soul.
author: Josh Billings

lines: To thrive in life you need three bones. A wishbone. A backbone. And a funny bone.
author: Reba McEntire

lines: When we feel love and kindness toward others, it not only makes others feel loved and cared for, but it helps us also to develop inner happiness and peace.
author: The 14th Dalai Lama

lines: Love is the the most radically subversive activism of all, the only thing that ever changed anyone.
author: Ann Voskamp

lines: Your circumstance doesn’t make life extraordinary. Love does.
author: Trina Harmon

lines: All you need is love.
author: Paul McCartney & John Lennon

lines: Fear less, hope more; Eat less, chew more; Whine less, breathe more; Talk less, say more; Love more, and all good things will be yours!
author: Swedish Proverb

lines: Occasionally in life there are those moments of unutterable fulfillment which cannot be completely explained by those symbols called words. Their meanings can only be articulated by the inaudible language of the heart.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

lines: What counts can’t always be counted; what can be counted doesn’t always count.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: Normal day, let me be aware of the treasure you are. Let me learn from you, love you, bless you before you depart. Let me not pass you by in the quest of some rare and perfect tomorrow.
author: Mary Jean  Irion

lines: Enjoy all you have while pursuing all you want.
author: Jim Rohn

lines: We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures.
author: Thornton Wilder

lines: The molecules of your body are the same molecules that make up the nebulae, that burn inside the stars themselves. We are star stuff.
author: Victor Tenbaum

lines: What I admire in Columbus is not his having discovered a world, but his having gone to search for it on the faith of his own opinion.
author: Turgot

lines: Create the highest, grandest vision possible for your life, because you become what you believe.
author: Oprah Winfrey

lines: Aerodynamically, the bumble bee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesn't know it so it goes on flying anyway.
author: Mary Kay Ash

lines: Working hard is important. But there is something that matters even more: believing in yourself.
author: Harry Potter (J.K. Rowling)

lines: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.
author: John R. Wooden

lines: I have missed more than 9,000 shots in my career. I have lost almost 300 games. On 26 occasions I have been entrusted to take the game winning shot...and I missed. I have failed over and over and over again in my life. And that's precisely why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

lines: Your present circumstances don’t determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
author: Nido Qubein

lines: You must do the thing which you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

lines: Motivation is when your dreams put on work clothes.
author: Benjamin Franklin

lines: There is no chance, no destiny, no fate, that can hinder or control the firm resolve of a determined soul.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

lines: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

lines: The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
author: Cecil B. DeMille

lines: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

lines: Dreams and dedication are a powerful combination.
author: William Longgood

lines: Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life.
author: Golda  Meir

lines: Each time we face our fear, we gain strength, courage and confidence in the doing.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

lines: Be who you are and say what you feel, because in the end those who matter don't mind and those who mind don't matter.
author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

lines: Confidence comes not from always being right, but from not fearing to be wrong.
author: Peter McIntyre

lines: Every small positive change we make in ourselves repays us in confidence in the future.
author: Alice Walker

lines: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it.
author: Margaret Thatcher

lines: Great changes may not happen right away, but with effort even the difficult may become easy.
author: Bill Blackman

lines: Stay committed to your decisions, but stay flexible in your approach.
author: Tom Robbins

lines: Commitment unlocks the doors of imagination, allows vision, and gives us the right stuff to turn our dream into reality.
author: James Womack

lines: Once a man has made a commitment to a way of life, he puts the greatest strength in the world behind him. It's something we call heart power. Once a man has made this commitment, nothing will stop him short of success.
author: Vince Lombardi

lines: We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided.
author: J.K.  Rowling

lines: Individually, we are one drop. Together, we are an ocean.
author: Ryunosuke Satoro

lines: Wisdom is knowing we are all One. Love is what it feels like and compassion is what it acts like.
author: Ethan Walker III

lines: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

lines: The essence of the beautiful is unity in variety.
author: Felix Mendelssohn

lines: Peace begins with a smile.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: It isn’t enough to talk about peace. One must believe in it. And it isn’t enough to believe in it. One must work at it.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

lines: We plant seeds that will flower as results in our lives, so best to remove the weeds of anger, avarice, envy and doubt, that peace and abundance may manifest for all.
author: Dorothy Day

lines: Choose love and peace will follow. Choose peace and love will follow.
author: Mary Helen Doyle

lines: When we have peace in our hearts and minds, we draw peace into our lives.
author: Iyanla Vanzant

lines: Hope is like the sun, which, as we journey toward it, casts the shadow of our burden behind us.
author: Samuel Smiles

lines: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope.
author: Bradley Whitford

lines: Let your hopes, not your hurts, shape your future.
author: Robert H. Schuller

lines: A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.
author: Brad Henry

lines: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement.
author: Helen Keller

lines: Always reward your long hours of labor surrounded by your family. Nurture their love carefully, remembering that your children need models, not critics. And even if you have failed at all else in the eyes of the world, if you have a loving family, you are a success.
author: Og Mandino

lines: Family is not an important thing. It's everything.
author: Michael J. Fox

lines: The only rock I know that stays steady, the only institution I know that works, is the family.
author: Lee  Iacocca

lines: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
author: George Bernard Shaw

lines: The family is one of nature's masterpieces.
author: George Santayana

lines: …find out where joy resides, and give it a voice far beyond singing. For to miss the joy is to miss all.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

lines: Watch the sunrise at least once a year, put a lot of marshmallows in your hot chocolate, lie on your back and look at the stars, never buy a coffee table you can't put your feet on, never pass up a chance to jump on a trampoline, don't overlook life's small joys while searching for the big ones.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

lines: Happiness, not in another place, but this place not for another hour, but for this hour.
author: Walt Whitman

lines: I’m beginning to recognize that real happiness isn’t something large and looming on the horizon ahead, but something small, numerous and already here. The smile of someone you love. A decent breakfast. The warm sunset. Your little everyday joys all lined up in a row.
author: Beau Christopher Taplin

lines: The joy we feel has little to do with the circumstances of our lives and everything to do with the focus of our lives.
author: Russell M. Nelson

lines: The struggle ends when gratitude begins.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

lines: Two kinds of gratitude: the sudden kind we feel for what we take; the larger kind we feel for what we give.
author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

lines: Invite your heart to be grateful and your thank yous will be heard even when you don't use words.
author: Pavithra  Mehta

lines: We should certainly count our blessings, but we should also make our blessings count.
author: Neal Maxwell

lines: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more.
author: Melodie Beattie

lines: A pessimist, they say, sees a glass as being half empty; an optimist sees the same glass as half full. But a giving person sees a glass of water and starts looking for someone who might be thirsty.
author: G. Donald Gale

lines: Infinitely more important than sharing one's material wealth is sharing the wealth of ourselves—our time and energy, our passion and commitment, and, above all, our love.
author: William E. Simon

lines: The best thing to give to your enemy is forgiveness; to an opponent, tolerance; to a friend, your heart; to your child, a good example; to a father, deference; to your mother, conduct that will make her proud of you; to yourself, respect; to all men, charity.
author: Benjamin Franklin

lines: Generosity consists not the sum given, but the manner in which it is bestowed.
author: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi

lines: The way you get meaning into your life is to devote yourself to loving others, devote yourself to your community around you, and devote yourself to creating something that gives you purpose and meaning.
author: Mitch Albom

lines: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
author: Jonas Salk

lines: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.
author: Tom Bodett

lines: It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart.
author: Anne Frank

lines: You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one.
author: John Lennon

lines: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same.
author: Anne Frank

lines: If you don't know the guy on the other side of the world, love him anyway because he's just like you. He has the same dreams, the same hopes and fears. It's one world, pal. We're all neighbors.
author: Frank Sinatra

lines: Touch the earth, speak of love, walk on common ground.
author: Steven Van Zandt

lines: Our similarities bring us to a common ground; our differences allow us to be fascinated by each other.
author: Tom Robbins

lines: Humankind has not woven the web of life. We are but one thread within it. Whatever we do to the web, we do to ourselves. All things are bound together. All things connect.
author: Chief Seattle

lines: We don't need to share the same opinions as others, but we need to be respectful.
author: Taylor Swift

lines: In recognizing the humanity of our fellow beings, we pay ourselves the highest tribute.
author: Thurgood Marshall

lines: The capacity for getting along with our neighbor depends to a large extent on the capacity for getting along with ourselves. The self-respecting individual will try to be as tolerant of his neighbor's shortcomings as he is of his own.
author: Eric Hoffer

lines: Respect is love in action.
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana

lines: If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.
author: Henry David Thoreau

lines: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

lines: No soul that aspires can ever fail to rise; no heart that loves can ever be abandoned. Difficulties exist only that in overcoming them we may grow strong, and they who have suffered are able to save.
author: Annie Besant

lines: Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.
author: J.K.  Rowling

lines: Although the world is full of suffering, it's full also of the overcoming it.
author: Helen Keller

lines: When we face the worst that can happen in any situation, we grow. When circumstances are at their worst, we can find our best.
author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

lines: A good character is the best tombstone. Those who loved you, and were helped by you, will remember you when forget-me-nots have withered. Carve your name on hearts, not on marble.
author: Charles Hadden Spurgeon

lines: You express the truth of your character with the choice of your actions.
author: Steve Maraboli

lines: Character consists of what you do on the third and fourth tries.
author: James Michener

lines: Character, the willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life, is the source from which self-respect springs.
author: Joan Didion

lines: Thoughts lead on to purposes; purposes go forth in action; actions form habits; habits decide character; and character fixes our destiny.
author: Tyron Edwards

lines: One must care about a world one will not see.
author: Bertrand Russell

lines: If you want to make a difference and leave your world a better place, let others know how important they are as you put their needs above yours.
author: Jaren L. Davis

lines: I feel the capacity to care is the thing which gives life its deepest significance.
author: Pablo Casals

lines: Caring about the happiness of others, we find our own.
author: Plato

lines: For every beauty there is an eye somewhere to see it. For every truth there is an ear somewhere to hear it. For every love there is a heart somewhere to receive it.
author: Ivan Panin

lines: You don’t inspire your teammates by showing them how amazing you are. You inspire them by showing them how amazing they are.
author: Robyn Benincasa

lines: The mark of great sportsmen is not how good they are at their best, but how good they are at their worst.
author: Martina Navrátilová

lines: Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play.
author: Mike Singletary

lines: If character is what you do when no one is watching, then sportsmanship is that conduct with everybody watching.
author: Bob Ley

lines: One man practicing sportsmanship is far better than a hundred teaching it.
author: Knute Rockne

lines: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: Robert  Brault

lines: Sometimes you will never know the value of a moment until it becomes a memory.
author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

lines: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Appreciation is a wonderful thing. It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.
author: Voltaire

lines: Forget yesterday - it has already forgotten you. Don't sweat tomorrow - you haven't even met. Instead, open your eyes and your heart to a truly precious gift - today.
author: Steve Maraboli

lines: Your body is the harp of your soul and it is yours to bring forth sweet music from it or confused sounds.
author: Kahlil Gilbran

lines: I don't dwell on my age. It might limit what I can do. As long as I have my mind and health, it's just a number.
author: Nola Ochs

lines: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
author: Benjamin Franklin

lines: Health and cheerfulness naturally beget each other.
author: Joseph Addison

lines: Eat healthily, sleep well, breathe deeply, move harmoniously.
author: Jean-Pierre Barral

lines: Ask not for an easy life...ask for the strength to face the elements, to weather the storms; to be the might for the right and the weak, to be the voice for those who cannot speak, to see one's dreams to fruition with dignity, integrity, and grace.
author: Giac  Nguyen

lines: Storms make trees take deeper roots.
author: Dolly Parton

lines: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi

lines: Real strength is not just a condition of one's muscle, but a tenderness in one's spirit.
author: McCallister Dodds

lines: Pray not for easy lives, pray to be stronger men.
author: John F. Kennedy

lines: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Muriel Strode

lines: And in the end it's not the years in your life that count; it's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

lines: Live today. Not yesterday. Not tomorrow. Just today. Inhabit your moments. Don't rent them out to tomorrow.
author: Jerry Spinelli

lines: Do not let making a living prevent you from making a life.
author: John R. Wooden

lines: You only live once - but if you work it right, once is enough.
author: Joe E. Lewis

lines: A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
author: Saint Basil the Great

lines: Life is not so short but that there is always time for courtesy.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: If a man be gracious and courteous to strangers, it shows he is a citizen of the world, and that his heart is no island cut off from other lands, but a continent that joins to them.
author: Sir Frances Bacon

lines: Nothing is ever lost by courtesy. It is the cheapest of pleasures, costs nothing, and conveys much.
author: Erastus Wiman

lines: I place a high moral value on the way people behave. I find it repellent to have a lot, and to behave with anything other than courtesy in the old sense of the word - politeness of the heart, a gentleness of the spirit.
author: Fran Lebowitz

lines: The whole purpose of education is to turn mirrors into windows.
author: Sydney Harris

lines: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
author: Aristotle

lines: The purpose of education is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
author: Malcolm S. Forbes

lines: Education is a social process. Education is growth. Education is not a preparation for life; education is life itself.
author: John Dewey

lines: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

lines: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
author: Sir Winston Churchill

lines: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says, 'I'm possible'!
author: Audrey Hepburn

lines: There’s always going to be bad stuff out there. But here’s the amazing thing - light trumps darkness every time. You stick a candle into the dark, but you can’t stick the dark into the light.
author: Jodi Picoult

lines: I didn't lose the gold. I won the silver.
author: Michelle  Kwan

lines: If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant; if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome.
author: Anne Bradstreet

lines: New beginnings are often disguised as painful endings.
author: Lao Tzu

lines: When nothing is sure, everything is possible.
author: Margaret Drabble

lines: When one door closes another door opens; but we so often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door, that we do not see the ones which open for us.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

lines: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

lines: Not knowing when the dawn will come, I open every door.
author: Emily Dickinson

lines: Good manners and soft words have brought many a difficult thing to pass.
author: Sir John Vanbrugh

lines: Good manners have much to do with the emotions. To make them ring true, one must feel them, not merely exhibit them.
author: Amy Vanderbilt

lines: The real test of good manners is to be able to put up with bad manners pleasantly.
author: Kahlil Gilbran

lines: Respect for ourselves guides our morals; respect for others guides our manners.
author: Lawrence Sterne

lines: I seek constantly to improve my manners and graces, for they are the sugar to which all are attracted.
author: Og Mandino

lines: The sign of a beautiful person is that they always see beauty in others.
author: Omar Suleiman

lines: I think your whole life shows in your face and you should be proud of that.
author: Lauren Bacall

lines: A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.
author: Roald Dahl

lines: To be beautiful means to be yourself. You don’t need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

lines: It is not beauty that endears, it’s love that makes us see beauty.
author: Leo Tolstoy

lines: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
author: Ronald Reagan

lines: Each of us can look back upon someone who made a great difference in our lives, someone whose wisdom or simple acts of caring made an impression upon us. In all likelihood it was someone who sought no recognition for their deed other than the joy of knowing that, by their hand, another's life had been made better.
author: Stephen M. Wolf

lines: It is one of the most beautiful compensations of life, that no man can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Sometimes our light goes out but is blown into flame by another human being. Each of us owes deepest thanks to those who have rekindled this light.
author: Albert  Schweitzer

lines: To strengthen the muscles of your heart, the best exercise is lifting someone else's spirit whenever you can.
author: Dodinsky

lines: If everyone helps to hold up the sky, then one person does not become tired.
author: Dr. Askhari Johnson Hodari

lines: Where there is unity there is always victory.
author: Publius Syrus

lines: So powerful is the light of unity that it can illuminate the whole earth.
author: Baha'u'llah

lines: If civilization is to survive, we must cultivate the science of human relationships - the ability of all peoples, of all kinds, to live together, in the same world at peace.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

lines: The dictionary is the only place that success comes before work. Hard work is the price we must pay for success. I think you can accomplish anything if you're willing to pay the price.
author: Vince Lombardi

lines: Striving for success without hard work is like trying to harvest where you haven't planted.
author: David Bly

lines: It seems the harder I work, the more luck I have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

lines: The highest reward for man's toil is not what he gets for it, but what he becomes by it.
author: John Ruskin

lines: Far and away the best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

lines: Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.
author: Charles William Eliot

lines: Reading is a way for me to expand my mind, open my eyes, and fill up my heart.
author: Oprah Winfrey

lines: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.
author: Joseph Addison

lines: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.
author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

lines: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

lines: Go forward in life with a twinkle in your eye and a smile on your face, but with great purpose in heart.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

lines: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

lines: A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.
author: William Arthur Ward

lines: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.
author: Joseph Addison

lines: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: There comes a time in the spiritual journey when you start making choices from a very different place. And if a choice lines up so that it supports truth, health, happiness, wisdom and love, it’s the right choice.
author: Angeles Arrien

lines: It's not hard to make decisions when you know what your values are.
author: Roy Disney

lines: You must never be fearful about what you are doing when it is right.
author: Rosa Parks

lines: Always do right. This will gratify some people and astonish the rest.
author: Mark Twain

lines: Don't count the days. Make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

lines: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

lines: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
author: Og Mandino

lines: If you're doing your best, you won't have any time to worry about failure.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

lines: The enemy of great is good.
author: David Foster

lines: Do the best you can until you know better. Then when you know better, do better.
author: Maya Angelou

lines: You can’t put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the farther you get.
author: Michael Phelps

lines: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

lines: If you have a dream, don’t just sit there. Gather courage to believe that you can succeed and leave no stone unturned to make it a reality.
author: Dr. Roopleen

lines: All our dreams can come true; if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

lines: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
author: Earl Nightingale

lines: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

lines: A river cuts through rock, not because of its power, but because of its persistence.
author: James N. Watkins

lines: To endure is greater than to dare; to tire out the hostile fortune; to be daunted by no difficulty; to keep heart when all have lost it- who can say this is not greatness?
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

lines: Diamonds are nothing more than chunks of coal that stuck to their jobs.
author: Malcolm S. Forbes

lines: Vitality shows in not only the ability to persist but the ability to start over.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

lines: Volunteers do not necessarily have the time; they just have the heart.
author: Elizabeth Andrew

lines: To the wrongs that need resistance, To the right that needs assistance, To the future in the distance, Give yourselves.
author: Carrie Chapman Catt

lines: The heart of a volunteer is never measured in size, but by the depth of the commitment to make a difference in the lives of others.
author: DeAnn Hollis

lines: Volunteering is at the very core of being a human. No one has made it through life without someone else’s help.
author: Heather French  Henry

lines: I don't know what your destiny will be, but one thing I do know: the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who have sought and found how to serve.
author: Albert  Schweitzer

lines: With courage you will dare to take risks, have the strength to be compassionate, and the wisdom to be humble. Courage is the foundation of integrity.
author: Keshavan Nair

lines: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

lines: We have come into this exquisite world to experience ever and ever more deeply our divine courage, freedom and light!
author: Hafez

lines: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
author: e. e. cummings

lines: Fear is a reaction. Courage is a decision.
author: Sir Winston Churchill

lines: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

lines: Men succeed when they realize that their failures are the preparation for their victories.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: I believe luck is preparation meeting opportunity. If you hadn’t been prepared when the opportunity came along, you wouldn’t have been lucky.
author: Oprah Winfrey

lines: Give me six hours to chop down a tree, and I will spend the first four sharpening the ax.
author: Abraham Lincoln

lines: The best preparation for tomorrow is to do today's work superbly well.
author: Sir William  Osler

lines: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
author: Woodrow Wilson

lines: You cannot get through a single day without having an impact on the world around you. What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
author: Jane Goodall

lines: Do more than belong: participate. Do more than care: help. Do more than believe: practice. Do more than be fair: be kind. Do more than forgive: forget. Do more than dream: work.
author: William Arthur Ward

lines: I am only one, but still I am one. I cannot do everything, but still I can do something; and because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do something that I can do.
author: Edward Everett Hale

lines: The world is not interested in what we do for a living. What they are interested in is what we have to offer freely - hope, strength, love and the power to make a difference!
author: Sasha Azevedo

lines: What lies behind us, and what lies before us are but tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: At the end of the day, tell yourself gently: 'I love you, you did the best you could today, and even if you didn't accomplish all you had planned, I love you anyway.'
author: Anonymous

lines: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
author: Christian D. Larson

lines: One of the greatest moments in anybody's developing experience is when he no longer tries to hide from himself but determines to get acquainted with himself as he really is.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

lines: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live up to what light I might have.
author: Abraham Lincoln

lines: Wildness reminds us what it means to be human, what we are connected to rather than what we are separate from.
author: Terry Tempest Williams

lines: Plant seeds of happiness, hope, success, and love; it will all come back to you in abundance. This is the law of nature.
author: Steve Maraboli

lines: Thousands of tired, nerve-shaken, over-civilized people are beginning to find out that going to the mountains is going home; that wildness is a necessity.
author: John Muir

lines: I felt my lungs inflate with the onrush of scenery—air, mountains, trees, people. I thought, ‘This is what it is to be happy.’
author: Sylvia Plath

lines: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

lines: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

lines: The soul is the truth of who we are.
author: Marianne Williamson

lines: Our soul desires to be understanding, our ego is only concerned with being understood. When you are being understanding you are connected to your soul.
author: Michaiel Bovenes

lines: You must find the place inside yourself where nothing is impossible.
author: Deepak K. Chopra

lines: I am not this hair, I am not this skin, I am the soul that lives within.
author: Jalal ad-Din   Rumi

lines: Nobody is superior, nobody is inferior, but nobody is equal either. People are simply unique, incomparable. You are you, I am I.
author: Osho

lines: As you grow up, always tell the truth, do no harm to others, and don’t think you are the most important being on earth. Rich or poor, you then can look anyone in the eye and say, ‘I’m probably no better than you, but I’m certainly your equal.
author: Harper Lee

lines: We become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings, different hopes, different dreams.
author: Jimmy Carter

lines: We may have different religions, different languages, different colored skin, but we all belong to one human race. We all share the same basic values.
author: Kofi Annan

lines: Equality is the soul of liberty; there is, in fact, no liberty without it.
author: Frances Wright

lines: We are the music-makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams. We are the movers and shakers of the world forever, it seems.
author: Arthur O' Shaughnessy

lines: I have a habit of letting my imagination run away from me. It always comes back though... drenched with possibilities.
author: Valaida Fullwood

lines: What if it becomes less about how we look and more about how much we care? What if it becomes less about how much money we earn and more about how much we share our good fortune? Imagine a world where who we are in our hearts is the ultimate status symbol.
author: Amy Leigh Mercree

lines: Can you imagine what I would do if I could do all I can?
author: Sun Tzu

lines: You must give everything to make your life as beautiful as the dreams that dance in your imagination
author: Roman Payne

lines: Be soft. Do not let the world make you hard. Do not let pain make you hate. Do not let the bitterness steal your sweetness. Take pride that even though the rest of the world may disagree, you still believe it to be a beautiful place.
author: Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.

lines: Nurture your minds with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

lines: Faith is to believe what you do not yet see; the reward for this faith is to see what you believe.
author: Saint Augustine

lines: Everything will be okay in the end. If it's not okay, it's not the end.
author: John Lennon

lines: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

lines: A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.
author: Amelia Earhart

lines: Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness.
author: George Sand (Amantine Aurore Lucile Dupin)

lines: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
author: Aesop

lines: Those who make compassion an essential part of their lives find the joy of life. Kindness deepens the spirit and produces rewards that cannot be completely explained in words. It is an experience more powerful than words. To become acquainted with kindness one must be prepared to learn new things and feel new feelings. Kindness is more than a philosophy of the mind. It is a philosophy of the spirit.
author: Robert J. Furey

lines: Constant kindness can accomplish much. As the sun makes ice melt, kindness causes misunderstanding, mistrust, and hostility to evaporate.
author: Albert  Schweitzer

lines: I don't want to get to the end of my life and find that I just lived the length of it. I want to have lived the width of it as well.
author: Diane Ackerman

lines: It's never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot [Mary Ann Evans]

lines: Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power, and magic in it.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

lines: And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom.
author: Anaïs Nin

lines: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo  Emerson

lines: Anyone can look for fashion in a boutique or history in a museum. The creative explorer looks for history in a hardware store and fashion in an airport.
author: Robert S. Wieder

lines: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
author: Pablo Picasso

lines: To be creative means to be in love with life. You can be creative only if you love life enough that you want to enhance its beauty, you want to bring a little more music to it, a little more poetry to it, a little more dance to it.
author: Osho

lines: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
author: Erich Seligmann Fromm

lines: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

lines: Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.
author: Joseph Campbell

lines: When you are joyful, when you say yes to life and have fun and project positivity all around you, you become a sun in the center of every constellation, and people want to be near you.
author: Shannon L. Alder

lines: When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy.
author: Jalal ad-Din   Rumi

lines: Joy is a decision, a really brave one, about how you are going to respond to life.
author: Wess Stafford

lines: Joy is a net of love in which you can catch souls.
author: Mother Teresa

lines: It is a grand thing to rise in the world. The ambition to do so is the very salt of the earth. It is the parent of all enterprise, and the cause of all improvement.
author: Anthony Trollope

lines: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

lines: The very substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream.
author: William Shakespeare

lines: Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
author: Bill Bradley

lines: Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.
author: Salvador Dali

lines: There is no greater gift you can give or receive than to honor your calling. It's why you were born. And how you become most truly alive.
author: Oprah Winfrey

lines: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
author: Robert  Byrne

lines: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

lines: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
author: Pablo Picasso

lines: When you know who you are; when your mission is clear and you burn with the inner fire of unbreakable will; no cold can touch your heart; no deluge can dampen your purpose. You know that you are alive.
author: Chief Seattle

lines: If you really want to do something, you'll find a way. If you don't, you'll find an excuse.
author: Jim Rohn

lines: Most of us serve our ideals by fits and starts. The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
author: Cecil B. DeMille

lines: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
author: Vince Lombardi

lines: Dedication involves making the space to let young ideas take hold; every tree was once a seed and every company was once an idea.
author: Zephyr Bloch-Jorgensen

lines: Dedicate some of your life to others. Your dedication will not be a sacrifice. It will be an exhilarating experience because it is an intense effort applied toward a meaningful end.
author: Dr. Thomas Dooley

lines: What soap is to the body, laughter is to the soul.
author: Yiddish Proverb

lines: I will follow the upward road today; I will keep my face to the light. I will think high thoughts as I go my way; I will do what I know is right. I will look for the flowers by the side of the road; I will laugh and love and be strong. I will try to lighten another’s load this day as I fare along.
author: Mary S. Edgar

lines: A smile starts on the lips, a grin spreads to the eyes, a chuckle comes from the belly; but a good laugh bursts forth from the soul, overflows, and bubbles all around.
author: Carolyn Birmingham

lines: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

lines: Laugh my friend, for laughter ignites a fire within the pit of your belly and awakens your being.
author: Stella McCartney

lines: Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be.
author: Shel Silverstein
D. Simone

lines: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering 'it will be happier'...
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

lines: For last year's words belong to last year's language. And next year's words await another voice. And to make an end is to make a beginning.
author: T.S. Eliot

lines: When you realize nothing is lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
author: Lao Tzu

lines: Be happy in the moment, that’s enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.
author: Mother Teresa
